page.title: 18BROUGHAM CASTLE
page.content: {Medieval castle}by site of{Roman fort {Brocavum,}inscribed stones displayed. Fine{Norman keep}1170-80, rest mostly 13th/14th C, restored by Lady Anne Clifford 17th C, now mostly a ruin. Open to public since 1926, 16400 in 1979, 11658 in 1984 including school parties, some pupils' courses involving special interest in keep. In 1984 English Heritage took over management, has plans to increase access between interesting features and provide toilets. Open every day, adults 50p, children/elderly 25p, parties over 11 10% discount. Attractive site for recreation beside River Eamont where weir controls flow for swimming pool and fishing.
